accuracy.description: The degree to which the provided answers are correct and complete.

accepted_values.25%: Some parts of the task are correctly addressed, but the majority is incorrect or incomplete.
accepted_values.50%: Half of the task is correctly addressed.
accepted_values.75%: Most of the task is correctly addressed, with some minor errors or omissions.
accepted_values.100%: The task is fully and correctly addressed.

relevance.description: The relevance of the provided answers to the given question.

accepted_values.not_relevant: The answers provided are not relevant to the question.
accepted_values.partially_relevant: The answers provided are partially relevant to the question.
accepted_values.mostly_relevant: The answers provided are mostly relevant to the question with some irrelevant parts.
accepted_values.fully_relevant: The answers provided are fully relevant and on-topic.

reasoning_trace_clarity.description: The clarity and traceability of the reasoning steps taken to reach the final answer.

accepted_values.not_traceable: No reasoning steps can be identified.
accepted_values.partially_traceable: Some reasoning steps are identified, but the trace is incomplete or unclear.
accepted_values.mostly_traceable: Most reasoning steps are clear and traceable with some lapses.
accepted_values.fully_traceable: All reasoning steps are explicitly stated and easy to follow.

completeness.description: The extent to which the multi-agent system's solution addresses all aspects of the task.

accepted_values.fragmented: The answer addresses only a small part of the task.
accepted_values.partly_complete: The answer addresses a good part but not all aspects of the task.
accepted_values.nearly_complete: The answer addresses most aspects of the task with only trivial aspects missing.
accepted_values.complete: The answer addresses every aspect of the task fully.

efficiency.description: The efficiency of the process in terms of steps taken to reach a solution relative to the minimal number of steps possible.

accepted_values.inefficient: Many more steps than necessary are taken, indicating inefficiency.
accepted_values.moderately_efficient: Some extra unnecessary steps are taken.
accepted_values.efficient: Nearly all steps taken are necessary, with minimal redundancy.
accepted_values.highly_efficient: All steps taken are necessary, with no redundancy.

robustness.description: The ability of the system to cope with errors or unexpected inputs.

accepted_values.non_robust: The system fails at the first sign of an error or unexpected input.
accepted_values.somewhat_robust: The system can handle minor errors or unexpected inputs but fails with anything more.
accepted_values.robust: The system can handle a range of errors or unexpected inputs reasonably well.
accepted_values.highly_robust: The system can handle nearly all errors or unexpected inputs without failing.
